etymologies: Old English sīde ‘left or right part of the body’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zijde and German Seite, probably from a base meaning ‘extending lengthways’

definitions: a position to the left or right of an object, place, or central point

examples.text: a town on the other side of the river
on either side of the entrance was a garden
Rachel tilted her head to one side

shortDefinitions: position to left or right of object

definitions: either of the two halves of an object, surface, or place regarded as divided by an imaginary central line

examples.text: she lay on her side of the bed
the left side of the brain

shortDefinitions: either of two halves of object, surface, or place regarded as divided by imaginary central line

definitions: the right or the left part of a person's or animal's body, especially of the human torso

examples.text: he has been paralyzed on his right side since birth

shortDefinitions: right or left part of person's or animal's body

definitions: a place or position closely adjacent to someone

examples.text: his wife stood at his side

shortDefinitions: place or position closely adjacent to someone

definitions: either of the lateral halves of the body of a butchered animal, or an animal prepared for eating

examples.text: a side of beef

shortDefinitions: either of lateral halves of body of butchered animal, or of animal or fish

definitions: an upright or sloping surface of a structure or object that is not the top or bottom and generally not the front or back

examples.text: a car crashed into the side of the house
line the sides of the cake pan
a side entrance

shortDefinitions: upright or sloping surface of structure or object that is not top or bottom and generally not front or back

definitions: each of the flat surfaces of a solid object

examples.text: cubes with a different decoration on each of the six sides

shortDefinitions: each of flat surfaces of solid object

definitions: either of the two surfaces of something flat and thin, such as paper or cloth

examples.text: comments should not exceed one side of A4 paper
the flysheet is silicone protected on both sides

shortDefinitions: either of two surfaces of something flat and thin, such as paper

definitions: the amount of writing needed to fill one side of a sheet of paper

examples.text: she told us not to write more than three sides

shortDefinitions: amount of writing needed to fill one side of sheet of paper

definitions: either of the two faces of a record or of the two separate tracks on a length of recording tape

examples.text: the other side of the original 78 is free of any distortion
put the tape on and listen to a whole side

shortDefinitions: either of two faces of record or of two separate tracks on length

definitions: a part or region near the edge and away from the middle of something

examples.text: a minivan was parked at the side of the road
cabins on the south side of the clearing

shortDefinitions: part or region near edge and away from middle of something

definitions: each of the lines forming the boundary of a plane rectilinear figure

examples.text: the farm buildings formed three sides of a square

shortDefinitions: each of lines forming boundary of plane rectilinear figure

definitions: a person or group opposing another or others in a dispute, contest, or debate

examples.text: the two sides agreed to resume border trade
whose side are you on?

shortDefinitions: person or group opposing another or others in dispute or debate

definitions: a sports team

examples.text: there was a mixture of old and young players in their side

shortDefinitions: sports team

definitions: the position, interests, or attitude of one person or group, especially when regarded as being in opposition to another or others

examples.text: Mrs. Burt hasn't kept her side of the bargain
the conservationists are on the city's side of the case

shortDefinitions: position, interests, or attitude of one person or group

definitions: a particular aspect of a situation or a person's character

examples.text: her ability to put up with his disagreeable side

shortDefinitions: particular aspect of situation or person's character

definitions: a person's kinship or line of descent as traced through either their father or mother

examples.text: Richard was of French descent on his mother's side

shortDefinitions: person's kinship or line of descent as traced through either their father or mother

definitions: subsidiary to or less important than something

examples.text: a side dish of fresh vegetables

shortDefinitions: subsidiary to or less important than something

definitions: a dish served as subsidiary to the main one

examples.text: sides of German potato salad and red cabbage

shortDefinitions: dish served as subsidiary to main one

definitions: horizontal spinning motion given to a ball.
shortDefinitions: horizontal spinning motion given to ball

crossReferenceMarkers: another term for English (sense 3 of the noun)
shortDefinitions: spin given to cue ball in snooker and billiards by hitting it on one side

definitions: support or oppose in a conflict, dispute, or debate

examples.text: he felt that Max had betrayed him by siding with Beatrice

shortDefinitions: support or oppose in conflict or debate

definitions: provide with a side or sides; form the side of

examples.text: the hills that side a long valley

shortDefinitions: provide with side or sides
